text: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was ei1:informed Thursday that he would ei2:face a formal ei21:investigation into whether he ei3:abused the frailty of Liliane Bettencourt, 90, the heiress to the L'Oreal fortune and France's richest woman, to ei4:get funds for his 2007 presidential ei1000:campaign. Mr. Sarkozy has ei5:denied ei6:accepting illegal campaign funds from Ms. Bettencourt, either personally or through his party treasurer at the time, Eric Woerth, as ei7:alleged by her former butler. Mr. Sarkozy's lawyer, Thierry Herzog, ei8:called the judge's ei9:decision, which ei10:indicates that the judge ei11:believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a ei23:crime, "incoherent" and "unjust." The lawyer ei13:said he would ei14:appeal. The ei15:ruling does not necessarily ei16:mean that Mr. Sarkozy, who ei17:lost his re-election ei18:bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution, will ei19:stand ei20:trial.

Mr. Sarkozy's lawyer, Thierry Herzog, ei8:called the judge's ei9:decision, which ei10:indicates that the judge ei11:believes that Mr. Sarkozy probably committed a ei23:crime, "incoherent" and "unjust." The lawyer ei13:said he would ei14:appeal. The ei15:ruling does not necessarily ei16:mean that Mr. Sarkozy, who ei17:lost his re-election ei18:bid last May and with it his presidential immunity from prosecution, will ei19:stand ei20:trial.

Before ei41:retiring in 1984, Mr Lowe ei42:worked as an Inspector of Schools with the Department of Education and Sciences, and he ei43:leaves three sons from a previous ei57:marriage.
The last British climbing member of the 1953 team, Mike Westmacott, ei44:died last June.
